intro: Phyllanthus helferi, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, pale green leaves and inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Phyllanthus helferi is notable for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine, where it is used to treat various ailments. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of tropical flora and ethnobotany.
